QuestionStem: Scientists are not exactly certain why the little arctic tern makes the migration journey of 70,000 km round trip each year. Which statement below do you think is the most likely explanation?

options.AnswerText: A. The arctic terns are following patterns of food availability and favorable wind conditions from pole to pole.
options.Feedback: Think again about the cause and effect patterns of migration. Which of explanation fits best with the migration patterns of other animals?

options.AnswerText: B. The arctic terns are being carried from pole to pole by wind currents.
options.Feedback: Think again about the cause-and-effect patterns of migration. Which explanation fits best with the migration patterns of other animals?

options.AnswerText: C. The arctic terns are traveling from pole to pole to find mates.
options.Feedback: Think again about the cause-and-effect patterns of migration. Which explanation fits best with the migration patterns of other animals?

FinalIncorrectFeedback: Based on the cause-and-effect patterns of migration observed in other animals, the terns are most likely using favorable wind conditions to travel from pole to pole in search of food.
